alert.note: Alert for Central Interior (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 21 at 3:20PM AKDT until April 24 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with low visibility expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 inch. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. Visibility one half mile or less at times. * WHERE...Over Elliot Highway Summits between Livengood and Manley Hot Springs. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to noon AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Large snow drifts will form. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will develop this evening and continue into Saturday. Northeast winds gusting to 40 mph are expected to develop over Elliot Highway Summits late tonight and continue through Monday. This will cause blowing snow with low visibility.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
